website_summaries.verdict: With an adaptable fit to most runners' bodies, this 3-pack is a steal.
pros: Lightweight in fit and feel with the added benefit of helping reduce wear and tear on your body
Those who love this product highlight the fabric's feel and adaptability
We love that you get 3 pairs for what could easily sell for the price of one
cons: Known to sag, especially if you're on the leaner side

customer_reviews.title: Cannoli and Meatballs
customer_reviews.text: My entire life is a lie. I've been wearing briefs, boxers, boxer briefs since I graduated from diapers. Once I slipped these on, the difference was night and day. I wear these things at all times. No more elastic hem digging into parts that don't need digging. These things are like a bra for your cannoli and meatballs.
customer_reviews.author: david richardson

customer_reviews.title: Something changed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these about 8 months ago and they were good and cheap to wear to the gym. I would call them compression shorts as if anyone has ever worn a good set knows that there is zero compression in these. But for the price, they do the job nicely for easy running and weightlifting. What I dont ger is why they changed the material up. It is noticeably thinner and just doesn't feel the same. The seams come apart after one wash and no longer can dry them with out it shrinking. Last set never had this problem and could dry them without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: mo

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled: Not compression shorts
customer_reviews.text: I needed compression shorts at the suggestion of my physical therapist to recover from a hip surgery. These are just tight underwear, which is funny, since they do "compress" your bits and pieces, but not what the PT wanted. My fault since I didn't do my research into what medical grade compression shirts are. You got me this time, whomever Neleus from China is - so I will keep them, since someone in my family may like to be ...compressed lol!
customer_reviews.author: P. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: If I was able to give half a star, I’d give these compression shorts 2 1/2 stars. I’m giving the benefit of the doubt and round up because they are comfortable and they are cost-efficient. That being said... the stitching is extremely prominent and the picture shown is after 2 washes.. I noticed it is already starting to come apart in one area. The quality just isn’t there. I will say again that they are extremely comfortable. Just wish they were a little more durable..
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: No more chafing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to reduce chafing on my daily 5 mile walks and western mountain hunts where a lot of walking is involved. I'm very pleased with these shorts, which I wear under my pants/regular shorts. No chafing. I bought size XL, which fits well for my 37" waist.
customer_reviews.author: Randy J

customer_reviews.title: Good quality... Zero support
customer_reviews.text: This is a top quality product, well made and holds up very well. There's only one problem and for me it's a deal breaker. There is zero support for the boys. Having my dangley bits flopping around hither and yon while I'm running or working is not optimal. Maybe they assume you'll wear a cup but my running is not full contact so I've never considered doing that. Wearing underwear underneath them defeats the whole purpose since no other kind of underwear deals with sweat the way compression shorts do. The problem could be fixed with a little extra stitching but I'm not a seamstress.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Dad

customer_reviews.title: These are rad!
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’11, 263 pounds, and I ordered these in a XL and they fit great. I use these for when I’m going to the gym, a bike ride, hiking. I’ve seen some reviews that these aren’t for “athletic guys” but that’s not the case unless you’re going to be really picky. I use these for powerlifting meets and just regular working out and they’re amazing at keep everything in place. They do make your nether region hot sometimes though so do remember that.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: THIN
customer_reviews.text: I recommend that you only buy the black spandex if you want to exercise without anything over them. The spandex is so thin that my dick print was showing, if that's your thing than gross but if it's not I warned you.
customer_reviews.author: World Peace 4 EVERYONE!

customer_reviews.title: Made well and fits as expected
customer_reviews.text: First off for size reference I bought the mediums and I am a 6 foot 195lb, athletic build male. These fit perfect and provide sufficient compression and protection. I have only used them a couple of times and have only washed them a couple of times but they seem to be well built and should last a couple of years. I wear them cycling and jogging and they are great for each and the three pack is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Cato

customer_reviews.title: Confortable!
customer_reviews.text: I have been riding with cotton boxer briefs for years and these are so much better! They draw moisture away from your body and dry quickly. I wear 34 inch waist briefs. I bought these X-Large and they fit well. They are form fitting, streach but not overly tight. Guys, they hold things in the proper place for cycling. If I wanted a snugger fit, I probably could have gotten away with a Large, but my cycling shorts are snug spanex so X-large is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: The New Mexico Man

customer_reviews.title: Not a hardcore gym guy
customer_reviews.text: I mean, if I'm being honest, I just needed some boxer type of short that would hold my dong in place while on the rower at the gym / while in a swimsuit at the beach. Normally rock some Calvin Klein boxer briefs, but they just don't have the crotch hug factor. I guess they're not the hardcore compression shorts that gym rats would wear, but they're not too far off. These fit as I would expect as a 5'9 - side Medium everything male.
customer_reviews.author: Minion

customer_reviews.title: Thigh Length
customer_reviews.text: I can't say if they are good or bad quality because I didn't even try them on. When I took them out of the package, they looked small. When I read the review, it said the length of the thigh was 9". I don't know if they stretched it while measuring or if they gave the length of a 4x, but I ordered XL and they weren't even close. Less than 7". Soooooooo disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: I was sick of regular boxers riding up, so I gave these a try.
customer_reviews.text: I think these boxers are really good. They've retained their "compression" after being washed multiple times. I was getting a bit nuts with regular boxers riding up my butt and generally just getting bunch up around my legs. I tried to buy these one size smaller than I thought I would need based on other reviews and I think they work well. They are nice and tight (I wear them under my shorts, so who cares :)) and now I am not going crazy constantly trying to keep my underwear from riding up. If you are tired of boxers riding up, get these slightly smaller than you need and I think you'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great underwear for larger athletic types.
customer_reviews.text: Best underwear for the price. I struggle to find underwear that I can wear to workout with or wear in my work suits. I am 6’1” 215lbs and I like to run and I swear a lot. I need underwear that helps with chaffing. These underwear do a better job than Nike or under armor and are a fraction of the price. And they are comfortable enough to wear for work in my suits. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Descano

customer_reviews.title: Great value, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really like this brand, specially their shirts. The shorts are not bad, they are really comfortable and fit good. The two negatives for me are: 1) Compression is not as good as some other brands I wear. 2) They are a little thinner that other brands. Obviously those two things are a personal preference thing. But overall I think they are a good value
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Castro

customer_reviews.title: Not good fit in important places
customer_reviews.text: The material feels great how ever it does not fit right in the important places.
customer_reviews.author: Captain

customer_reviews.title: I like 'em!
customer_reviews.text: Prior to stumbling across these, I used to workout in my underwear... at home of course. But if I found myself somewhere like in a hotel gym or if I wanted to go jogging through the neighborhood, I would have to get creative and find something else to cover up with. These shorts are perfect for working out! They fit similar to underwear, stretchy in the right places, lightweight but aren't underwear so I can wear them guilt-free anywhere I need to workout or jog.
customer_reviews.author: Chop Stix

customer_reviews.title: Why buy Nike?
customer_reviews.text: First week using them. Compared to name brands, they feel more or less the same but cost far less. No excessively thick seams that dig into your skin and the waistband doesn’t feel too “sharp” on my stomach fat. Just make sure you’re honest with yourself about what size you need before you order. They are tight and that’s how they are supposed to be, so if you prefer a looser fit, order at least a size up. Maybe two.
customer_reviews.author: Randy F. Stallion

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for 20 bucks
customer_reviews.text: I would say overall these are pretty decent. They are the most durable drawers I've ever had or maybe I'm just tough on them idk. These fit pretty well, I will say the first few times they are worn some glue or something must come off of them and gets on the inside of the lower leg which causes the hair to stick and well it's not fun or pretty. But if you shave your legs for some reason u dont have to worry about that part. I am literally on the fence right this second on whether to order a few more packs or try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: mp

customer_reviews.title: Buy Under Armor or Nike. Anything else.
customer_reviews.text: They fit around my thighs just fine. The width was good. The problem for me was the length. They did not cover my rear end properly. I do a lot of yoga and these are terrible. I cannot bend over without revealing myself, they are so bad. Spend the extra money, buy a good quality brand like Under Armor, Nike, or Adidas. Wearing these in a public workout facility will leave you embarrassed.
customer_reviews.author: Viva La Grover

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: To start I have own compression shorts, compression leggings, three quarter leggings from all the major brands and needed a pair of athletic type briefs to run in. I consider them to be more like briefs than compression pants. In my other pants the mid seam is more tight to prevent injury. I play a lot of high impact sports and I don't think these would help prevent injury like my other. Overall they serve the purpose I bought them for.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Lacks Compression, thin material
customer_reviews.text: These are not bad by any means but they're not quality. The material is thin and will wear quickly, and it does not have the compression that quality brands do. For the price, I guess it's hard to complain. If you plan to wear these under your shorts for workouts, etc., then I would recommend looking at another brand. They tend to run a little long down the thighs (i'm 5'7 and ordered a medium).
customer_reviews.author: K. Hari

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, comparable to Nike
customer_reviews.text: At first I have doubt about the quality of the paints since it is so cheap compare to Nike version . however, after trying it on these days, I have to say it is almost equal to Nike battle pro paints ... the size is kind of same as your boxer underwear , namely if you wear m size , you probably pick M as well for these sport pains . I definitely will buy more if needed and also will recommend to my friends .
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for..
customer_reviews.text: Shorts fit as expected...The waist band didn't roll down and the shorts wear snug but not tight...I just received them and used them once but they seem to be good quality and should last a long time... I would recommend this product...
customer_reviews.author: Shooter

customer_reviews.title: Amazon customer service take great care of me
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave 1 star since I was only sent 2 pair instead of 3. Amazon customer service take great care of me, so I'm changing my review. The product is amazing. I bought them for my boyfriend who is an auto mechanic. With his old underwear, he was having chaffing problems and issues with his underwear riding up. Not to mention the 105 degree heat here doesn't help. I bought these compression shorts for him, and he is in love! I even ordered more because his chaffing problem is completely gone. He always says they are super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Alana Crabb

customer_reviews.title: Even Better than the Big Companies.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best compression shorts I've ever worn. Better than Nike, UA, Adidas, etc... These are actually better than all those big companies. Get them while they are cheaper because I have a feeling this company is going to blow up in the near future!!
customer_reviews.author: Will Frost

customer_reviews.title: the elastic stretched faster than any underwear i've ever had
customer_reviews.text: the cheapest boxers i've ever had have elastic bands that lasted for years.. this brand, however, in about 4 months rapidly lost their elasticity around the waist. this to the point that they cant hold themselves up without me sewing the band tighter.. i made sure to wash them on cool, and hang dry for extra safety. pathetic product
customer_reviews.author: SuperSeth00

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for thigh rub and hot days!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Even for bigger people! I’m 5’ 11” and weigh 250lbs, with a 38-40” waist. An XL fits PERFECT. Not to tight to where it leaves sores on your waist but not to loose to where your butt crack shows when you bend over. It’s the PERFECT thing if you have big thighs that rub together, and they’re much cooler wearing on the hot days. I ordered a 3 pack, and I’ll be ordering more and switching to strictly these as boxer shorts from now on. So comfortable. Very happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: SO Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for the first time and I LOVE them. I've been wearing them for a little over a week now and they are definitely as described. Extremely comfy, thin but keep everything in it's place (unlike the other brands that use super tick material that become uncomfortable throughout the day), and they're very flexible for when I workout. Will definitely order more!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Nice workout underwear, long in the leg
customer_reviews.text: Depending what you are looking for, these perform very well. I purchased these, the Adidas and the Reebok's all at the same time to compare. All perform very well, but these are noticeably longer in the thigh than the others - if you want a longer pair, get these, if you want a shorter pair of boxer briefs, get the Adidas or Reebok.
customer_reviews.author: rykauff

customer_reviews.title: Some issue with workmanship
customer_reviews.text: I bought a total of 4 sets (12 shorts). They wear and wash and dry just fine. Of the twelve, however, two are cut a bit on the skimpy side, and do not come all the way to my waist, and remain there. It is bothersome, but not enough to warrant their return but enough to earn this product only 3-stars
customer_reviews.author: Roger Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Great brand, not their best product.
customer_reviews.text: Getting a 3 pack of compression shorts to workout in at this price is uncommon to say the least. These are definitely usable but they are not be my first pick between these, my Hanes compression shorts, and my Nikes. Mostly i'm not a fan because even though i got the right size, i have a 31" waist and i got a medium, the crotch is entirely to baggy they feel more like normal boxers than compression shorts.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan H.

customer_reviews.title: Holes in waist line
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t even worn them once and/or washed them and when I went to put them on there’s already two small holes in them. Very disappointed. Won’t recommend or buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Rind

customer_reviews.title: Just not for me
customer_reviews.text: I did return this product because it didn't have the amount of compression that I wanted. I was looking for a lot of compression to keep my thigh muscles from moving so much when I ran on my treadmill. I do think it would serve its purpose if you wanted to use it as a base layer under some workout shorts.
customer_reviews.author: John and Heidi Strong

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. I'm a skinny guy so they fit a little big on me. I usually wear mediums because I'm too tall for smalls but I ordered an adult small because I knew they would probably be too loose if I got medium, and they were still too big on me. They're really long (which isn't necessarily a bad thing) but they were a little bit loose on me, again probably because I'm too skinny. But overall, not a bad product. Worthy of 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best every day underwear!
customer_reviews.text: Best underwear purchase! I have a demanding job that can be walking for miles and loading trucks, to driving for hours at a time. These are the best underwear I have purchased. Working out or lounging, they’re great. After a couple of months a couple of the pairs were staring to get worn from my jeans, but no holes yet. I bought an extra set and being split so much has extended their life.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great set of Compression Shorts
customer_reviews.text: bought these to replace some old Under Armor compression shorts that were getting old. They performed great and were very comfortable as I bought them before hiking Pictured Rocks National Shoreline on Lake Superior were we backpacked up to 17 miles a days. I will buy again once I need new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas W

customer_reviews.title: Your thighs will thank you.
customer_reviews.text: If you're trying to lose weight as bigger guy and find chaffing an issue, these magical shorts will solve those friction issues. Your thighs will glide past each other easily even during the worst of a Texas July can throw at you. Held up to repeated machine washing so far; will update if they start to unravel like other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: I use them every weekend to work and one mon-thurs for the gym. I work at an automotive shop so a lot of stairs, kneeling, crouching, and sweating. Haven't had any rips or anything, at first they were a bit uncomfortable until I got used to the feeling of the stitching.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: They are worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give a few weeks before giving a review really give them a couple weeks to break in. They are washed in a machine no special treatment, line dried. They are holding up well the elasticity seems as good now as the first time I wore them. The price is great for the product would definitely suggest these as a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: charles Jones

customer_reviews.title: Exposes the crackulus.
customer_reviews.text: The three pairs do not fit all the same. The blue pair is the only one that fits great. The other two seem to have less material or not a stretchy material in the butt. When you bend over the band comes down and exposes the crack to the world. Very weird these are not consistent. I love the Neleus shirts though.
customer_reviews.author: R S Irwin

customer_reviews.title: 2 of 3 fit. Glad I went up
customer_reviews.text: 6'1. 215. 34" waist. Large quads. I went up to XL the way other reviews suggested. They have great length and fit well. One of the three was extremely tight around the quads and just felt like a large and not an extra large. that's the only downside.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Benitez

customer_reviews.title: Best Value
customer_reviews.text: Don't fall for the trappings of the expensive name brands! These are great quality for an amazing price. I recall buying my first pair of these types of compression shorts about 30 years ago for $40. Today you get the same quality and design for significantly less... Great product, you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: steve clason

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love these things I wear them under my gym shorts every time I work out so people don’t see my nuts when I do leg lifts and stuff. Plus they look cool fit great, you can wear them as regular underwear if you want.
customer_reviews.author: Top 500 Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, but wear long shorts
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! I bought these for running and playing basketball at the gym. My only issue with them is the length - I like most of my running shorts to land just above my knees and these peek out a little at the bottom of some pairs of shorts. I will probably buy again, but will first check to see if there is a shorter version.
customer_reviews.author: vaultsoc

customer_reviews.title: Great for the gym and hiding your junk!
customer_reviews.text: I love these compression shorts. I bought them to use for the gym when working out. I wear them under my shorts or joggers because when I wear regular boxers or my calvins, it shows my junk. Now I can wear any jogger or shorts, and run, jump, bench, squat, deadlift without having to worry about my huge junk showing through...
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: I personally don't like these. I ordered a small
customer_reviews.text: I personally don't like these. I ordered a small, I have a 29" waist, and am 5' 7" and I find them too large. They're loose around the thighs and extend almost to my knees (beyond the shorts I wear over them). I expect compression shorts to be tight fitting and preferably not visible. I'd recommend the Champion Men's compression shorts instead. I've bought several pairs and regret trying something new this time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael King

customer_reviews.title: Size may differ
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought these and I loved them. They fit perfect and they were exactly what I needed and wanted. I selected buy again, same size with no change and the second set was completly smaller than the first. Didn't even feel like the same material.
customer_reviews.author: Kendrick Barber

customer_reviews.title: Sizing isn't the most consistent
customer_reviews.text: Some are more comfortable than others in the pack. The blacks are by far the most comfy whereas the greys ran a tad small and felt cheap. But they're pretty cheap and I use them for HIIT sessions so the discomfort, whenever present, does not last long.
customer_reviews.author: samuel kim

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely amazing. They fit just right and really keep everything where it needs to be at all times. My biggest issue was chaffing while I ran, so I needed something that would keepe dry and not allow my thighs to rub. Well this right here sis the job and much more. The comfortably of these are spot on and will have you wondering what you were doing before... I know I thought about it so I bought a second pack. And it was worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used them enough to see how they hold up to many wears and washes but these are super comfortable. I got them because I wanted something that would hold everything in place while at the gym. It does that without being overly tight.
customer_reviews.author: ZeroCreativity

customer_reviews.title: Not for me...
customer_reviews.text: So, I'm new to the whole "compression shorts" thing, and maybe my expectations were too high. I was looking for something to replace the classic jock in the gym for good support and comfort, plus check out the whole "improved performance" that compression is supposed to bring. The material feels nice, and the fit around the legs and butt does provide a nice snug fit. But, for me, there's no support for my junk at all. I'm not lacking for a package, but it felt more like freeballing down there, so it just didn't do it for me. Not giving up on compression shorts, though. Just need to keep shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Mrtin Tuttle

customer_reviews.title: Watch the sizing.
customer_reviews.text: Theses didn’t really do the job for me. For my first order I followed the sizing recommendations from the MFG. Too big. But they were comfortable as regular underwear so I kept them. Ordered them again but a size smaller. Still too lose. I’ll probably go with UA for my next order. I have skinny legs.
customer_reviews.author: Carl from Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for running, waist band coming apart.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for running only. They are very comfortable. A few washes in on pair has the waist band already coming apart. Disappointed in that but just a fair warning for future buyers. Wish I had a pair for each day, but now have to wash quickly to have for next run.
customer_reviews.author: Damon

customer_reviews.title: I really like them!
customer_reviews.text: They actually feel great. I plan on buying more. I just won't be buying any black ones. I bought a multi-color pack (gray, blue, black) and, although they are the same size, the black ones are a bit tighter than the other two. Not bad enough to return, but they will be the ones I wear when all the others are in the laundry. The size difference is the only thing keeping me from a five star review.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Link

customer_reviews.title: Not very good
customer_reviews.text: If you want compression shorts that actually compress, find a different product. The fabric on these is very low quality. And, unless you buy them several sizes too small they will not provide a snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: Russell B Sprague

customer_reviews.title: No Front Opening
customer_reviews.text: Rides a little low and has no opening in the front for easy access. Material is ok I guess but overall not super comfortable. The seams are noticeable all day long but not sure if there is anyway for them not to be.
customer_reviews.author: David Schlosser

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Low Price
customer_reviews.text: My son wear these under his rugby shorts and loves them! He is 5'3" and they extend to just above his knees. They made it through a season full of practices and games with no issues. Would purchase again and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Crecy

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good fit, maybe not the highest quality though
customer_reviews.text: They're very nice and they feel like they're not even there most of the day. Material is on the thin side, but that's not a bad thing. They breathe very well. One issue was the seam on the waistband started coming up on one pair after just one day of wearing. There doesn't seem to be any way to reach customer service for the seller, so it's impossible to try to get it replaced. Regardless, at this price, i'm not complaining.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Frascella

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves
customer_reviews.text: He loves them and they hold up well! Dont know if this is a thing for other guys but my husband would get ingrown hairs on the inside of his thighs with regular cotton briefs but since wearing only these he has not had a problem yet.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Great shorts!
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of shorts, I ordered them in my usual size, they are nice and snug, but not too tight. Update: the fit of these shorts is more like traditional boxer briefs, recommend ordering one size down for good compression.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Loved the way they fit, wore the three that I received and even ordered another set of three, but after washing the first set that I had purchased one of them was coming apart on one of the seems...Was a little disappointed since I had thought i had found some good compression shorts at a descent price...i hope the rest don't start falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good material but fits terribly
customer_reviews.text: This product has heavy duty stitching, which is great for durability bit doesn't allow the product to fit very well. Material feels nice and seems to overall be fairly durable but once again, did not fit well.
customer_reviews.author: The one true reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing to wear all day every day!
customer_reviews.text: So this is weird and most people who know call it strange or say “why the heck do you do that?” I wear compressions with every outfit—khakis pants, khaki shorts included. I used to only wear and wash one pair of Under Armour compressions. But my wife bought me these... I was skeptical. I loved them right away. I soon bought another pack. I now have 6 pairs of these. I wear them everyday and those Under Armour compressions haven’t been worn since. Get these and you will love them.. even if you wear them everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Brea & Mark

customer_reviews.title: Needed a Supplement
customer_reviews.text: Our son was in need of a few more pairs of compression shorts for track. Local shops didn’t have his size available for a couple of weeks. Neleus was available within 2 days. Fit was comparable to UA, told that they are softer
customer_reviews.author: ricknjill

customer_reviews.title: cheap stretchy material
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, if you are lucky that is. High quality compression shorts cost around $80 to $100. I knew these were more just like underwear when I bought them but I expected them to fit a little tighter.
customer_reviews.author: Davy.Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Meh?
customer_reviews.text: They don’t compress enough to actually work. If you pull them up high enough to support your bits then they ride up the rear or hang around your belly button. Got them for running and don’t like running in them.
customer_reviews.author: Jules Morgenstern

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Suggest Purchasing These
customer_reviews.text: Ordered “small,” but they fit more like a medium in the waist. First time I wore a pair for a workout, I noticed the stitching was substantially coming undone. Spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: RangeRat

customer_reviews.title: Weak thread doesn’t belong in technical fabrics
customer_reviews.text: Inconsistent stitching, lower quality materials, but for the price I guess you get what you pay for. Photo as shown is after washing from one use and a first wash pre-wear. At these prices, even one defective one per 3 pack might be fine for some people, but this one isn’t likely to be usable again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Weiskoff

customer_reviews.title: I bought these to run and they are incredible
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to run and they are incredible. I immediately bought another set. I will never buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Schlosser

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Item fitted small, probably should have gotten a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really good quality for not a lot of money!
customer_reviews.text: These feel better than any under armour or shock doctor compression shorts. They hug the thighs comfortably and provide a lot of support during workouts. All in all top shelf. Will absolutely order more! I am 170 and 5’10” and the mediums feel great!
customer_reviews.author: jakethesnake365

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: The husband loves these! Wears a pair every time he goes out walking or running and when he goes to do his kickboxing. Highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: April Blackstone

customer_reviews.title: Not compression shorts. Good boxer briefs
customer_reviews.text: Too soon to comment on quality, fits great good length but; these are not compression shorts. They are just average swamp ass, ass chafing, ball bouncing long length boxer briefs. looking for cheap compression shorts? Move along Cheap long length boxer briefs? Add to cart Not sure where all these high reviews are coming from. Anyone who’s actually athletic or worn real compression shorts would know these are simply boxer briefs. Great for sitting on the couch or grocery getting.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for A+
customer_reviews.text: I have gained weight and my legs and inner thighs we’re rubbing and become sore because of the friction in was painfully discomfort to me , I did research and found out about these and I love them they stop the friction between my legs and brought me comfort I will be re-ordering more
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gym use under a pair of shorts.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for wearing under shorts when going to the gym. The fit is good with the right amount of support at the band without cutting off circulation. I wash then air dry mine so they have held up well.
customer_reviews.author: gapwedge

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: For the price these are great. I was shocked to eat a pack of three at that price point. They are a tinge on the light side. Have only wore them a few timed. Might have to update this post if they start tearing. No problems yet tho. Very happy with this purchase. Will Lee you posted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You gotta get these.
customer_reviews.text: As I have gotten older, I have noticed in hikes that I get skin tangs and these shorts have solved that issue. They are very comfortable. I live in a very hot climate and these shorts breath. Do not put them in a dryer...let them air dry.
customer_reviews.author: Chris. Redding

customer_reviews.title: The lowest leg stitch is very tight.
customer_reviews.text: Great price, but the stitch on the bottom of the leg hole is very tight (the rest of the short stretches but this doesn't). The rise is a more than I prefer but overall not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great value -- Good quality and fit
customer_reviews.text: These compression shorts are good quality at a nice price. The 3-pack costs about the same as one pair in a sporting goods store. They fit well and seem to be made well. I expect them to last a long time. The only negative is that they have a tag, but I was able to easily cut that off each pair of shorts.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Pritchett

customer_reviews.title: Good fit!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these. They are the only underwear he'll wear now. He says they are comfortable, keep everything in place, and perfect for working out or laying around.
customer_reviews.author: Natali

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: I've recently gotten into running and I've been wanting to buy some compression underwear. These fit great and are very comfortable. They are a bit long when worn with shorts, but I am a short guy 5'6, so I think that's to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Family Jewels
customer_reviews.text: The Neleus Compression shorts saved my marriage. Yes, I said it. My wife, who I love with my whole heart, was disgusted with me. Not because of the way I act, but the way I looked. Whenever we would do something active, my bulge was on and poppin. Unintentionally, I was making friends and family uncomfortable. Then I ordered the Neleus 3 pack. I went from an accidental sock puppet jumping around in my shorts at every stride, to a calm, cool and collected athlete. I can’t thank the product enough.
customer_reviews.author: FMountain

customer_reviews.title: Ordered a size up, washed & perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just like lots of others have said, order a size up and wash them. I'm currently about a 34" waist & shrinking. I bought the large. Package snug and secure. Clearly compression shorts and not just another pair of boxer briefs. Heading to the gym soon for a test run. Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: MWinAZ

customer_reviews.title: One time wear!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used a pair one time & the seam Split I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Decent shorts for the price
customer_reviews.text: Decent workout compression shorts that I wear under my shorts. Fits is very comfortable. Slightly larger than expected and material could be a little thicker/tighter but overall a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: I wear these under my shorts when working out at ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear these under my shorts when working out at the gym, to keep everyone from seeing the goods, if you know what I mean... They are very comfy as well, during all types of workouts, from strength training to cardio. No complaints, and would certainly buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I like these! they felt good during the game
customer_reviews.text: I like these! they felt good during the game....I got a xl they are stretchy shoulda got a large but they work....got the shirt too in xl now that I need fits perfect. and I'm 6'4" 220 or somewhere near there.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Solid but a little too long for my taste
customer_reviews.text: These fit well but are a bit too long for my taste. This causes them to show underneath my shorts when wearing them. Other than that, they’re great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Langer

customer_reviews.title: Little large
customer_reviews.text: These are great but the fit is a little large. My husband usually wears a large but had to order a small. He needed them to be VERY snug for post surgery support. For a regular fit, order one size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: ADB

customer_reviews.title: Too tight in the crotch
customer_reviews.text: The length is great but are too tight in the crotch region. My husband got the same size as any other underwear he has and he just doesn't like how these fit.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Covey

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit and no chaffing for cycling
customer_reviews.text: I cycle 100+ miles a week and I use these as liners for my bib shorts. They do the job and there is no chaffing. The seams aren't obtrusive and placed in the right places so as not to cause discomfort when riding. Not sure how durable these are but if I get a good riding season out of them, they'll be worth it, especially given the price.
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Quality and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really like these, seem to be pretty durable I wear them at work walking fast all day unloading semi trailers. These have been holding up well and are comfortable all day. And the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A.

customer_reviews.title: these bad boys fit pretty damn nice
customer_reviews.text: these bad boys fit pretty damn nice. my old navy are the best, the starter is a close second, and these guys are a solid 3rd place finish and they're the cheapest of the bunch. i've tried a few other brands and they just don't fit. these have a similar spandex/polyester ratio as the old navy and the starters, i think that's the ticket.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Hunn

customer_reviews.title: I like this product. Some personal discomfort issues though
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. Have bought them twice. The only issue I have with them is that they leave tread lines which feel like papercuts when I take them off. Work great for keeping sweat off the skin during workouts or sports activities.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D Kister

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as name brands
customer_reviews.text: I'm a size 32 waist and ordered the medium size. It fits perfect. I also have used Nike and Under Armour, and these compression shorts do exactly the same thing but come in a 3pack for way cheaper. Get these and save a lot of money!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: This was third times i bought from this same vendor, but different style and so far i haven't get any dissatisfaction. They fit perfectly and i can run 6 to 10 miles in them with no problems. Because of them i'm no longer have to worry about my thighs chafing. i'll continue to get a couple of packs every three to five months.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf Michel

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the big name brands
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big Under Armour supporter and I've used similar Bike, Franklin, and other brand compression shorts; these are just as good at a fraction of the price. Sorry Kevin Plank!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable compression shorts I've ever worn. Much better than the Nike and UA I've owned and way less pricey. They seem to run a little large too me. I'll get M instead of L next time.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended in price
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended as dont fit and material is also not per price. Not recommended as you can get much better material in similar price
customer_reviews.author: Truereview

product_meta.title: Neleus Men's 3 Pack Compression Short
product_meta.description:
Neleus was born in 2008 ,with its unique design concept, excellent quality and comfortable clipping, has gain the crazy love from the clients.
As the most energetic brand, Neleus is committed to provide the most innovative and price-friendly sport goods. 
Technological quality is the priority of the company's products. 

How To Choose Your Correct Size !
If you prefer a little tight fit, go up 1 size
feature_bullets: Please ignore the size chart provided by amazon,check the size chart of the third picture to select the appropriate size
The 4-way stretch and ergonomic streamlined design fits perfectly into your thighs, Excellent support for athletic activity, work or everyday wear
Compression design increases muscle power and decreases recovery time
Moisture Transport System and dries fast
Tight Fitting,like a second skin,prevents skin from chafing and irritation when you in the gym or running,make you comfortable all day
